newsitem.title: EGYPT: Arabs may hassle Israel at economy summit - Mubarak.
newsitem.headline: Arabs may hassle Israel at economy summit - Mubarak.

text.p: Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak warned Israel on Thursday that Arab countries at a regional economic summit in Cairo next month may hassle the Jewish state unless it makes progress in peace talks with the Palestinians.

"If the Israelis do not make quick progress in the peace process, it will be difficult for them to attend. We are not going to prevent them but other Arab countries participating might make problems," Mubarak told reporters while touring satellite industrial cities.
The conference, aimed at integrating Israel into the regional economy, will take place from November 12 to 14 with 85 states and more than 25 international organisations present.

Mubarak has repeatedly called on Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to reconsider his hardline policy towards peace and stop procrastinating on pledges signed with the Palestinians by the previous government.

Last month, he even linked the fate of the summit to progress in Palestinian-Israeli peace talks but on Thursday Mubarak repeated earlier comments that the meeting would take place next month as scheduled.
"It is in Egypt's interest to hold the meeting and several international firms are willing to attend," he said.
Earlier, Palestinian President Yasser Arafat said fresh negotiations with Israel on the thorny issue of withdrawing Israeli troops from Hebron had so far made no progress.
Israel has said both sides were willing to hear each other out and that it preferred longer peace negotiations.
